page.title: 05The Pottery
page.content: { The Big Pot} Mr.Start and a friend built a big pot. It took them one month. It took them 75 hours each and they worked 3 hours a night. The pot was made on a Potter's Wheel. We were allowed to look in it. It is over 7 feet high and weighs 1\ tons. The circumference is 17 feet and the diameter is over 5 feet. One handle of the pot costs Â£60. Mr.Start has been at the work shop for 9 years. He usually makes Terracotta which is gardenware. He uses chimney clay. {The Kiln} There is a very big kiln. When is is firing pots it has to be bricked up. It hasn't got a proper door. The garden pots are very good and would look good in the garden. The pots are all coil pots, even the big pot.
